system.description:
The shamash is the ser

vant of the synagogue and responsible for its well-being. He must ensure that the synagogue is clean and in good repair that it is available for all the community. He is also responsible for waking the community early each morning so that they can attend prayers and for making announcements concerning services, births, marriages, and deaths. 

 

As a shamash, the character must have the Educated (Hebrew) Virtue.
